attributes.action: We want government to start consultation on the future of Sure Start Centres.
attributes.background: During the 2014 election David Cameron made a commitment that his government would not close any Sure Start Centres but they would look at starting a consultation process as to its future. We want the government to start consultation ASAP as centres are in a funding crisis and closing as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Education starts when a child is born. It's a fact that those children using Sure Start Centres have obtained higher educational standards when entering mainstream schooling.

The government stated they would not close Sure Start Centres but funding to local authorities has reduced and as a result many have had to close. We need to look at expertise through consultation and secure funding that shows the importance of these Sure Start Centres, increase centres, give a child the best start in life.

attributes.action: Ban the Slaughter of Dartmoor Hill Ponies for Meat for Human Consumption
attributes.background: Dartmoor Hill Ponies are now being slaughtered for meat for human consumption. We call on the Government to halt the scheme which is both promoting moorland ponies as a meat product and also supplying the market. The Government must  enforce effective management of the Dartmoor Hill Pony herds.
attributes.additional_details: Apart from the fact we do not eat our companion animals here in the UK there are also concerns regarding the safety of the meat as, unlike farmed animals, the ponies are roaming free and their grazing is not monitored, therefore their meat may contain harmful substances such as wormers, bute and contraceptives.  The ponies are wild and unhandled and will be terrified at slaughter, their slaughter is inhumane.   Please sign this petition and help save  Dartmoor Hill Ponies from such cruelty!

attributes.action: Only the UK Government can end the Dog epidemic we have in the UK.
attributes.background:
Only the Government making changes will prevent many thousands of healthy dogs being put too sleep for no reason other than no one wants them or can take them in.
I predict 240,000 dogs a year will have to be put down in just 12 months time !
JUST FOUR SIMPLE STEPS WILL END THE DOG EPIDEMIC.
-
attributes.additional_details:
1,BAN PET SHOPS OR ANY OTHER THIRD PARTY FROM SELLING PUPPIES.
2, BAN  IMPORTING OF PUPPIES UNDER THE AGE OF 6 MONTHS.
3,  STOP FREE ADVERTISING OF PUPPIES ON GUMTREE, PRELOVED ETC.
4,   BREEDING LICENCES SHOULD BE ISSUED FOR NO MORE THAN THREE BREEDING BITCHES.
WHICH WILL CLOSE DOWN ALL PUPPY BREEDING FACTORIES AND FARMS.

( ILLEGAL PUPPY FARMS. )
If pet shops cannot sell the illegally bred puppies and they cannot sell them on the free add sites,they will have to stop breeding them.

attributes.action: Water safety to be taught as part of the national curriculum age appropriate.
attributes.background: Our loved ones need to understand the dangers in & around open water. The effects cold water can have on the body, The difference between a pool that is sanitized temperature controlled & lifeguarded, To bodies of open water such as quarries, lakes, reservoirs, rivers, canals  that hold many dangers
attributes.additional_details: My son was born on the 17th October 1997 He died on the 3rd of July 2011 age 13 swimming with friends in open water.I believe had Dylan been educated about the dangers in & around open water he would still be with us like so many others would be.Awareness is Prevention.There is no cure for this.A persons swimming ability often makes no difference to whether a person lives or dies. Many who lose their lives in open water never intended on even entering the water.Over 400 accidental deaths a year.

attributes.action: Require a by-election if rules on election expenses are broken
attributes.background: Parliament should change the law so that a by-election is automatically triggered if the financial rules on electoral expenses are proved to have been broken. Without a by-election in these cases, the legitimacy of the MP's seat is questionable.

attributes.action: Give all Military Families ASTs instead of Service Licence to Occupy in SFAs
attributes.background: Military Service Families living in SFA do not have Tenancy Agreements so have minimal rights including No Right to Repair. Therefore they are forced to live in Sub-standard homes. They need the respect they deserve as part of the Armed Forces Covenant to enable them to have Family Harmony
attributes.additional_details: AST's would protect Families. Any Company servicing Military Housing should be able to be held accountable through law for leaving families in properties of dis-repair.

attributes.action: Not enforce physical assessment on Dla claimants if already in receipt of Dla
attributes.background: It's wrong to make people already in receipt of Dla have to reapply and have to go through assessment and medical assessment when they have already proved eligibility and have qualified and been in receipt of Dla for years just because you want to cut the deficit
attributes.additional_details:
We all know the esa medical has not been as successful as the government would like us to believe with many qenuienly sick people loosing much needed benefits and deemed fit for work many of which have felt so lost they have taken there own lives because they felt there was no other choice left to them 
We need to stop the government enforcing disabled people rightly getting Dla being told they don't qualify for a benefit they have been getting for years simply to save money

attributes.action: Make English and Welsh waterways a public right of way
attributes.background:
Currently if you'd like to enjoy English and Welsh waterways you're likely to be accused of trespassing because the bed and banks of rivers and canals are privately owned, unlike Scotland/the rest of the world.

I believe our rivers should be open to all to enjoy.
attributes.additional_details:
Info from www.canoe-england.org.uk:
Over 96% of river systems are without public access.
The legal situation is unfavorable for access.
Owners of riverbeds and banks have riparian property rights, but do not own the water.
Riparian owners can exercise control over access to inland waters where there is not a right of access.
The Govt has agendas for increasing access to coastlines, physical exercise, improving health and outdoor education. 

Access to our rivers should be a right!

attributes.action: Increase carers earning limit
attributes.background: I received a letter from DWP saying I can earn £110 a week before my carers allowance is affected,how is this fair?With the new min wage at £7.20 ph working 16hours a week is £115.20 weekly,this means my carers allowance will stop. Please increase the earnings limit in line with the new living wage
attributes.additional_details: Letter from department for work and pensions disability and carers service. Letter dated 25/03/2016

attributes.action: Mandatory course/examination on food & drink for allergies & intolerances
attributes.background: My wife recently found out she was a Coeliac and I am allergic to nuts, as a chef I can’t believe the amount of chefs and catering staff that have no idea what these intolerance, allergies and illnesses are and how they can affect people.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that many of the trained and un-trained catering employees don’t have training on intolerances, allergies and food based illnesses, with more and more people suffering from nut allergies, Coeliac disease, lactose intolerance, as well as the other food based allergies such as egg, soya, seafood, this issue must be dealt with before anyone else dies or becomes extremely ill.
The death of Paul Wilson who suffered a severe anaphylactic shock after ordering a meal from an Indian take away,

attributes.action: Free British citizenship for all commonwealth soldiers and veterans
attributes.background: I am a South African, living in the uk, and think it's a disgrace, that I have to pay my way to get British citizenship. I have fought for the queen in Afghanistan yet I have to now pay, to live in the county I fought for!
attributes.additional_details: The fee for a settlement application within the UK will increase to £1,875. British citizen naturalisation fees for adults will increase to £1,156 and child registration fees to £936, which also represent 25% increases.2 Mar 2016

attributes.action: Allow subsidised MoD flights for family members to visit Falklands War Graves.
attributes.background: Widows and parents of British servicemen killed in the Falklands are required to pay the full fare of £2,200 to take chartered flights to visit their loved ones’ graves. This petition requests that the MoD allow family members full access to subsidised travel for the purpose of visiting war graves.

attributes.action: Give unmarried widows equal rights in registering paternity of their children
attributes.background: Joana's long-term cohabiting partner and father to her child died suddenly three weeks before the birth of their second child. As they were unmarried, she was obliged to prove her child's parentage upon the father's death. It was a costly and lengthy legal process, including providing DNA evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The 1953 birth and death certificate act does not allow registrars to have discretionary powers to register deceased parents when the parents are not married. 

We ask that registrars be given these powers to prevent widows from having to go through such a costly and dehumanising experience.

attributes.action: Make teacher training on ADHD compulsory in schools
attributes.background: So many parents are fighting to get a diagnoses for their child and when they finally get a Adhd diagnoses schools don't know how to manage it or simply dont believe it. Schools need more training. Stop labelling our children naughty and learn about the condition. Adhd is more complex! Make a change

attributes.action: Make it law that dogs must be kept on leads around livestock
attributes.background: For the second time in two years I have spent the last few hours trying to find our sheep who have been worried by a loose dog, we have a dead lamb and some very poorly ewes, last year we lost 13 ewes who were ready to lamb, this is happening all over the country and something needs to be done!

attributes.action: Reintroduce Tier 1 Post Study Work Visa for Non-EU students
attributes.background: The discontinuation of this visa affects thousands of students yearly after completing their studies in the UK. Many of us want to stay here after graduating but the difficulty in getting a visa to do so makes it almost impossible. Having this visa be reintroduced would help us and the UK as well.

attributes.action: Ban supermarkets from packaging fruits and vegetables
attributes.background: Climate change is the single biggest threat to society. In addition, contamination by plastics has become a major issue with research saying that by 2050 there could be more plastics in the ocean than fish. A small, positive step would be to stop supermarkets from packaging fruits and vegetables.
attributes.additional_details:
Such a ban would: 
- Reduce pollution (lower packaging production, less resources spent on recycling, reduced methane emissions from landfill sites) 
- Reduce strain on recycling facilities thus stop the export of waste (67% of British plastic waste is exported to the far east) 
- Increase consumer choice by avoiding bundling and decrease food waste (15m tonnes of food waste in the UK) 
- Lower prices of food 
- Contribute to a long-term vision of a zero waste society

attributes.action: We want the UN to monitor the UK  EU   In-Out Referendum
attributes.background: We as a nation want this referendum among British citizens to be a fair one... With that in mind .... shouldn't we be asking an impartial adjudicator such as the UN to oversee the vote count and make sure its a fair result?????
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron has now been forced to open the doors for us to have our say on our future as a nation with a Referendum in June this year.
2015 and previous elections proved how far political parties will go to cheat their way to a victory in local elections ... ballot boxes going missing, bogus postal votes, etc..... We want a fair referendum

attributes.action: Pay those born before 6/4/55 their state pensions as promised!
attributes.background:
All my life i believed i could retire and claim my state pension when i turned 60, The Government have robbed us of 6 years! it's not fair!  
PLEASE SIGN if you agree.

attributes.action: Arthritis/Anklyosing Spondylitis to be added to the NHS medical exempt list.
attributes.background: Anklyosing Spondylitis is an auto-immune disease effecting more than 200,000 people in the UK. Currently there is no cure, so the only way to manage the pain and flare up's is to take medication... Taking 20 tablets+ daily and not having free prescriptions.
attributes.additional_details: I am petitioning for Anklyosing Spondylitis and Arthritis sufferers to be given free prescriptions and both conditions to be added to the NHS medical exempt list. This condition can affect any of us, and is usually diagnosed in your twenties. Having to pay for prescriptions or prescription pre-payments till you're sixty is not fair, and it needs to be added to the medical condition exempt form.

attributes.action: Fast track naturalisation for EU citizens resident in the UK longer than 5 years
attributes.background: In view of the vote to leave the EU, implement a simplified fast track process to naturalise EU citizens who have settled in the UK for at least five years. The current naturalisation process is too expensive, overlong and bureaucratic, and penalises mixed EU-UK families.
attributes.additional_details: There are almost three millions EU citizens residing in the UK. Many have settled and created families with British citizen. The split of the UK from the EU will put that status of these people at risk because of the length, complexity and cost of the existing naturalisation process. A fast track process will also ease the pressure on the naturalisation office given the expected surge in applications from EU nationals.

attributes.action: Introduce 'Emily's Law' to ensure health and safety on privately-owned boats
attributes.background: 15 year old Emily Gardner from Gloucestershire died when her friend's boat capsized at sea. A catalogue of errors led to her death including the fact she was wearing a damaged and ill-fitting buoyancy aid. No laws currently exist to ensure that health and safety is observed on leisure craft.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tearful-mum-watches-schoolgirls-lifeless-8088025

https://assets.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/media/5614f0fce5274a6251000003/MAIBInvReport21_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Recognise the UK standard of firearm deactivation as equivalent to EU standards.
attributes.background: Proposed legislation in the Policing and Crime Bill intends to enforce the application of a EU standard that will result in firearms previously deactivated to UK Home Office standards being classified as defectively deactivated.  The EU standard is inferior to the UK standard and unnecessary here.
attributes.additional_details: The UK standard of deactivation is acknowledged as the best in Europe, and makes it impossible to re-activate a firearm without completely rebuilding the weapon. Imposition of the EU standard in the UK is a complete waste of taxpayers money, is disrupting a process previously recognised by government as effective in taking live firearms out of circulation, and penalises owners by making it illegal to sell or transfer safe UK deactivated firearms that will be unfairly classified as ‘defective’.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to have toilets available for claimants in Jobcentres.
attributes.background: I have read several instances of people attending meetings in Job Centres being refused permission to use toilets and then soiling themselves. Some disabilities mean that people need use of toilets urgently, one example is Crohn's Disease, but there are many others.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is one example of a disabled woman being refused use of a toilet in the Job Centre that was reported in the press:
http://www.yourlocalguardian.co.uk/news/11534035.Disabled_woman_s_humiliation_at_wetting_herself_when_refused_access_to_Jobcentre_toilet_sparks_national_debate/

attributes.action: Negotiate the possiblity of British citizens opting to keep their EU citizenship
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to pursue the creation of an EU national status or to ensure the status of EU citizenship for British nationals, who desire such status, during the period of negotiation following the triggering of Lisbon: Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
48% of voters in the EU referendum chose to remain and a prominently cited reason was for access to freedom of movement and the ability to travel - made possible only because we are EU citizens. 

Currently many UK nationals enjoy dual-nationality with many other European countries, usually because they have ties with or have lived in a country for a number of years. Since we all have ties to the EU and have lived there for many years we should be eligible for an EU dual-nationality status.

attributes.action: Save the Human Rights Act
attributes.background: The Human Rights Act is an important act designed to protect each and every individual from inequality and injustice be it from another individual, corporations or our own government. As such the decision to remove or change that protection should, ultimately lie with the people of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
In the past we've been rightly proud of our tough stance around the world on human rights. 
The UK will not extradite to a country where the death penalty is used. UK politicians have called for Guantanamo to be closed and laws criminalising homosexuality in Africa and elsewhere to be overturned. 
We accept that the Conservative party won the 2015 General Election with a majority, however a decision on something as important as this has to have the backing of the majority of the electorate, not just the 36% that voted Conservative. We are therefore asking you to do the right democratic thing and bring your proposal for a 'British Bill of Rights' before the electorate in a referendum and let them decide if they wish to opt for this, or keep the existing Human Rights legislation.

attributes.action: Make UK political advertising subject to the Advertising Code.
attributes.background: Political campaigning is a form of advertising, and like all other forms of advertising, it should be regulated. The recent referendum campaign highlights the urgent need for political advertising to become subject to the Advertising Code in the same way as other areas of advertising and marketing.
attributes.additional_details:
The Advertising Standards Authority ensures all adverts in the UK are "legal, decent, honest and truthful", and has the power to ban false advertising. However, their powers do not currently extend to political campaigning, meaning we have more protection when buying a toaster than voting in a referendum. 

An extension of the ASA's powers would strengthen our democratic system and protect free speech. Let's remove lies from our political discourse, and kick "post-truth politics" out of Britain.

attributes.action: Stop disabled parking space abuse in the UK, regardless of location or ownership
attributes.background: Many with disabilities struggle just getting in & out of a parked car, disabled bays are essential. It should be illegal for any non blue badge holder to park their car in a space reserved for those with disabilities. Without this 'The Equality Act 2010' is no longer effective.
attributes.additional_details:
Abuse of disabled parking bays is *rife all over the UK. Vehicles, skips, storage, smoking areas, temporary buildings, cancer screening/blood donor vehicles, temporary displays and more appear all too often in these bays, stopping those who NEED them from using them. Emergency Service Vehicles should ALSO have their own separate parking bay(s) to stop abuse of the disabled parking facilities - a disabled person cannot undo their disability. 

*Ref: www.facebook.com/wantmyspacetakemydisability

attributes.action: Make breastfeeding education an integrated part of PSHE curriculum in schools
attributes.background: Early education on breastfeeding  can improve the general health of society, reducing the risks of obesity, infection, cancer, osteoporosis and postnatal depression rates, by increasing the likeliness of successful breastfeeding for mothers in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.unicef.org.uk/Media-centre/Press-releases-archive/Breastfeeding-could-save-the-NHS-millions-says-new-report/


http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news/breastfeeding-linked-to-lower-risk-of-postnatal-depression

attributes.action: We call upon Parliament to repeal The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act immediately.
attributes.background:
A current petition to Call a snap General Election elicited the response « The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act means no Government can call a snap general election.... » from the government.

M.P.s make laws ; and can repeal them.

attributes.action: Consider taking EDM660 forward into law
attributes.background: Early Day Motion 660 "LEGAL RECOGNITION FOR PEOPLE WHO DO NOT ASSOCIATE WITH A PARTICULAR GENDER" proposes allowing UK citizens who do not identify as male or female to use the X marker in place of M or F on passports in accordance with existing aviation treaties.
attributes.additional_details: There are many individuals in the UK and around the world who do not identify as male or female. Bodies are typically male or female, though some cannot be placed in either category through natural variation, and we find the same holds true of minds. The use of the X marker would have no significant impact on bureaucracy and yet would allow those who fall through the gaps of the current system to be represented honestly in their documentation in a way that is accurate to their lived experience.

attributes.action: Reinstate funding for Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy (SDR) on the NHS
attributes.background:
SDR is a neurosurgical procedure aimed at reducing spasticity (tight and stiff muscle tone) in the lower limbs
The surgery aims to:
Achieve a long-term reduction in spasticity
Improve function and mobility
Increase independence 
Increase range of motion and improve positioning.
attributes.additional_details: Reduction in spasticity is immediately apparent after the procedure, but SDR unmasks any weakness and difficulties with co-ordinating movements. Through the physio programme, children will learn to use their body in a new way. There's now enough evidence to demonstrate that SDR is associated with substantial long-term benefits. These not only relate to reduction in spasticity, but also relate to improved movement, walking and an improved quality of life for both the children and their families.

attributes.action: A Start Date for the Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth & Tintwistle Bypass
attributes.background: After an 50 year wait, the government in 2014 [yet again] gave the go ahead for the A57/A628 Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth & Tintwistle Bypass to be built. Since then, locals and local politicians are unable to get a start date. We ask the government to name the day work will commence.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of people a day sit in the traffic queues that start on the M67 and continue through Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth and Tintwistle. People have been campaigning for the Longdendale Bypass (also known as the A57/A628 Mottram-in-Longdendale, Hollingworth & Tintwistle Bypass) for almost 50 years. In 2014, the Conservative government approved funding and said phase 1 (Mottram Bypass and Glossop Spur) would go ahead. Since then, the government has refused to give a start date.

attributes.action: Make working with electricity a criminal offence unless suitably fully qualified
attributes.background: Qualified Electricians demand stronger enforcement as to who can purchase goods and carry out electrical work. We undertake years of training for qualifications & accreditation for somebody to then carry out a 6 week course and become "competent". This is dangerous and an insult to our industry.
attributes.additional_details: Electrical installations are at the forefront of keeping this Great Britain running and have some of the highest regulations in the world.However, due to short term courses too many so called "competent persons" are carrying installation work no matter how small which is not upto standard. We want to see stronger enforcement for the sale of goods only to FULLY qualified electricians with installation becoming an offence if you are not. Electricity is extremely dangerous & is not taken seriously.

attributes.action: Make Breastfeeding awareness & social attitudes part of the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
The UK has the lowest breast feeding rate in the world, with only 17% successfully breastfeeding for up to 3 months, falling to around 1% after 6 months. 
We want future Mothers to feel there is no social stigma for either breast or bottle feeding, & that they have a choice.
#milknotguilt
attributes.additional_details:
Unicef have started a Call to Action on Breast Feeding in the UK. Details here: http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/News-and-Research/News/call-to-action/

See breast Feeding rates & figures for the UK here: http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/About-Baby-Friendly/Breastfeeding-in-the-UK/UK-Breastfeeding-rates/

NHS information r.e Breast Feeding: http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/pregnancy-and-baby/Pages/benefits-breastfeeding.aspx

Campaign hashtag #milknotguilt

attributes.action: Introduce a Brain Aneurysm Awareness Day
attributes.background:
It is critical to help raise awareness of brain aneurysms

Accurate early diagnosis is critical, as the initial hemorrhage may be fatal and may result in devastating neurologic outcomes.

Lives can be saved if people know the risks.
attributes.additional_details: Ruptured brain aneurysms are fatal in about 40% of cases. Of those who survive, about 66% suffer some permanent neurological deficit.Subarachnoid hemorrhage account for around 1 in 20 of all strokes. Approx 15% of patients with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage die before reaching the hospital.4 out of 7 people who recover from a ruptured brain aneurysm will have disabilities.There are almost 500,000 deaths worldwide each year caused by brain aneurysms and half the victims are younger than 50.

attributes.action: People with Irlen syndrome and dyslexia to get coloured lenses free on the NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a postcode lottery determines the cost of vital lenses which make a crucial difference to learning, vision and concentration. Some low income families are paying in excess of £200 for a pair of child's glasses which should be free.

attributes.action: Reopen all children's centres.
attributes.background: Children’s centres serve the most deprived areas and have high levels of usage. Children attending such centres show a good level of development at EYFS, and parents show a significant improvement in parenting skills and confidence. Financial cuts are forcing many children's centres to close.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/485346/DFE-RR495_Evaluation_of_children_s_centres_in_England__the_impact_of_children_s_centres.pdf

attributes.action: Pass the Cannabis (Legalisation and Regulation) Bill
attributes.background: A Bill to amend the Misuse of Drugs Act 1971 to provide for the lawful production, packaging, marketing, sale, purchase, possession and consumption of herbal cannabis in specific circumstances by certain persons; and for connected purposes.

attributes.action: Stop the building of large housing estates nationwide on green belt land.
attributes.background:
The government has pushed local councils to open restrictions on developing green belt land for large estates to be built.
This ignores brown field sites and housing that can be redeveloped.
I support the brown field development.
attributes.additional_details:
The original name given to the project in Sefton Council was The Core Strategy.
All the residents that knew about it raised objections that have not been addressed.
The plans have now been given the go ahead after a huge amount of money has been used for our supposedly cash strapped council to implement.
There reasons for the housing do not stand up to scrutiny. 
There is no infrastructure in place to accommodate the large estates. 
The dessicration of green belt land is therefore not required.

attributes.action: Provide All Children Under 16 With A Constant Glucose Monitor/Dexcom.
attributes.background:
Type One Diabetes, is a stressful, complicated disease. It is caused by the bodies immune system attacking itself, people have this disease through no fault of their own.
4 or more injections are needed daily in order for type ones to survive. As well as constant blood tests.
attributes.additional_details:
When a child is diagnosed, it is extremely difficult for a caregiver or parent to manage their Diabeties, due to them not knowing what their blood sugar levels are and will have to do more blood tests on that child than normal. A Constant Glucose Monitor, such as the Dexcom would make the child's quality of life so much better. A parent can also have some more reassurance that their child is not suffering from hypoglycaemia or hyperglycaemia. 
Type one diabetes can kill. We need this!

attributes.action: The UK must put a complete Ban on  Child Immigrants from anywhere in the world
attributes.background:
The United Kingdom is no longer in a position to accept all and sundry.We have enough problems with poor educational levels and a lack of housing and jobs for the indigenous populations of England,Scotland,Wales and northern Ireland.

We must insist that the European union use the existing rules.

attributes.action: Make it against the law to withhold a defibrillator.
attributes.background: We recently heard of a leisure centre withholding a defibrillator to a nearby school where a teacher was in cardiac arrest thankfully the said lady has survived but next the person may not be so lucky make it law that if you withhold a defibrillator you will be held accountable
attributes.additional_details: The said leisure centre said they withheld the defibrillator as part of health and safety guidelines this is crazy health and safety would rather have a death on their hands

attributes.action: Call on Andrea Leadsom to NOT hold a vote to repeal the Hunting Act 2004.
attributes.background:
Andrea Leadsom has pledged to hold a vote to repeal the ban. The Hunting Act outlaws the hunting of foxes, deer, hare and mink with dogs.

Hunting wild animals with dogs and letting them get ripped apart for ‘entertainment’ is cruel and inhumane, and has no place in our civilized society.
attributes.additional_details:
Animals suffer physiological and psychological stress when chased by a hunt, whether they are killed or not. This was established as fact back in 2000 by a parliamentary inquiry (Burns et al., 2000), which led to the ban. 

The below references have proof and further info:

Burns, L. et al. (2000) Report of the committee of inquiry into hunting with dogs in England and Wales. The Stationery Office, London.

https://www.league.org.uk/~/media/Files/LACS/Publications/A-case-against-A4-report.pdf

attributes.action: Stop Employment Agencies advertising jobs that don't exist.
attributes.background:
Recently I applied for two different jobs with agencies after spending over 2 hours filling out paperwork and talking to them about the job I went home expecting a phone call that I got promised. Two weeks later the job is still being advertised.
This has happened on many occasions.It has to STOP
attributes.additional_details: Employment agency's are falsely advertising jobs that don't exist.

attributes.action: Maintain Pension increases for British pensioners living in the EU.
attributes.background: Depending on what treaties are agreed for Britain's exit from the EU, some British pensioners living in the EU may lose their annual State pension increases. We call upon the Government of the United Kingdom to commit to maintaining these increases for all British pensioners living in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Annual State Pension for British pensioners living overseas are only paid in 16 countries outside of the EU and Britain has not signed any new treaties for this since 1981.  When Britain exits the EU, the mechanism that allows pension increases to be paid there will also cease.  For this reason, we call upon the Government of the United Kingdom to ensure that when the UK leaves the EU, appropriate provision is made with the European Union to allow the payment of these increases.

attributes.action: Death certificates to be given to parents of babies from 16 weeks
attributes.background: Please help me to change the law on registering the death of a baby from 16 weeks of pregnancy. I gave birth to my baby boy at 20 weeks pregnant. He did not breathe so I could not register him, which is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: Women who give birth to children prior to 24 weeks of pregnancy are unable to register the death of their babies. This is not fair as they are still babies and the death certificate means a lot. This is very hard for women and thousands of women have been through this. Please help me get the law changed so babies can be registered when they die.

attributes.action: Suspend benefit claimant assessments until a public inquiry is undertaken.
attributes.background: The assessment ideology and implementation has serious failings whose accumulated effect mandates an inquiry, and should be suspended until inquiry recommendations are put in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst helping claimants back into work is commendable, the implementation has serious failings :

1. Thousands assessed as fit for work died within 6 weeks
2. The report on these deaths was inappropriately held back
3. The assessment process is overly demanding, intrusive and inflexibly handled, often aggravating mental health issues of claimants
4. There are claims of flawed recording of assessments
5. The assessors are inappropriately given sanctions targets
6. The costs far exceed advantages

attributes.action: United Kingdom to not leave the EU
attributes.background:
We the undersigned wish to not leave the EU on the grounds that a four point difference in opinion is not sufficient enough to effect such a significant, life long change to our country.

Such a margin on a jury would not secure a verdict in a UK court of law, and should not secure a verdict here.
attributes.additional_details:
The results are possibly not legally binding, and can be taken as "advisory":

'An Electoral Commission spokesman said that the EU vote was an “advisory” referendum, as opposed to a “binary” referendum which has a fixed outcome.'
Source: http://www.express.co.uk/news/politics/681535/EU-referendum-result-what-happens-if-dead-heat-50-50-Brexit-remain-leave-vote-2016

attributes.action: Make the abuse and neglect of older people a crime
attributes.background: The constant reports of abuse and neglect of older people has gone on for too long. We are calling for such cruelty to be an aggravated criminal offence with statutory minimum sentences. This covers physical and sexual assault, financial and psychological abuse, and neglect.
attributes.additional_details: Most abusers are never charged, or if they are, they receive suspended sentences or community service. There are aggravated offences for Hate Crime, recognising basic charges are not enough. We want the same for older people. Action on Elder Abuse is a UK-wide charity that aims to protect and prevent the abuse of vulnerable older people. It has a national freephone helpline open Monday to Friday: 9:00 and 17:00 on 080 8808 8141 for confidential support and information. www.elderabuse.org.uk
